intro: Jonthlaspi hispidum, commonly known as the hispid pennycress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Jonthlaspi hispidum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in ecological succession.
